title: Valentine single-page prompt with evasive No button and Good choice meme reveal

requirements.summary: Implement a single-purpose Valentine prompt view with exactly two buttons: “Yes” and “No” (English).
acceptanceCriteria: The page shows a clear Valentine question and exactly two primary options labeled “Yes” and “No”.
All user-facing text is in English.
No other flows/pages/features are introduced beyond this interaction.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page Valentine UI in React + TypeScript: a centered romantic prompt with exactly two primary buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”, and local UI state to manage the interaction (no extra pages/routes).
Create the Tailwind CSS entry (including Tailwind directives) and base typography/layout defaults used by the Valentine page to keep styling consistent and uncluttered.

requirements.summary: Make the “No” button evade pointer and touch interactions so it cannot be successfully clicked/tapped.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, when the pointer enters/approaches the “No” button area, the button relocates to a new position within the visible viewport/container.
On touch devices (e.g., iPad Chrome), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move away before activation.
The “No” button never triggers a “No” confirmation state (no modal/alert/route) and is effectively unclickable in normal interaction.

file_operations.description: Add evasive behavior for the “No” button: position it within a bounded container and on pointer enter/move and touch start/move, compute a new safe position within the visible container (accounting for button size and padding) and move it before activation; ensure it cannot trigger a “No” state.

requirements.summary: On “Yes”, transition to a success view showing the meme image and the exact text “Good choice”.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” reliably transitions to a success state without page reload.
The success state includes the exact visible phrase “Good choice” and displays the meme image.
The meme image loads from a static asset path (not fetched from the backend).

file_operations.description: Implement the “Yes” click success state (no reload): replace/augment the prompt UI with a romantic confirmation view that renders the exact phrase “Good choice” and displays the static meme image from frontend/public/assets/generated/good-choice-meme.dim_900x600.png.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive romantic pink/white theme with consistent typography, spacing, and styling.
acceptanceCriteria: The primary background/surfaces and controls use a cohesive pink/white palette.
The design looks intentionally romantic (e.g., soft gradients, heart motifs, gentle shadows) while remaining simple and uncluttered.
Buttons and text have sufficient contrast and remain legible on iPad-sized screens.

file_operations.description: Define romantic theme styling using Tailwind base layers and CSS variables (pink/white palette, soft background gradient, readable default typography, gentle shadows) to ensure consistent styling across the single page and legible contrast on iPad-sized screens.
Apply Tailwind utility classes for the romantic layout and controls (pink/white surfaces, soft shadows, spacing, consistent typography) and keep the UI intentionally simple and single-purpose.

requirements.summary: Ensure smooth iPad Chrome interaction: responsive layout, touch-friendly targets, and no hover-only reliance.
acceptanceCriteria: Layout is responsive and fits common iPad viewport sizes in portrait and landscape without overflowing.
All primary interactions work via touch (Yes action, No evasion).
No horizontal scrolling is introduced by the moving “No” button (it stays within a bounded container/viewport).

file_operations.description: Make the layout responsive (centered container with max width, adaptive spacing) and touch-friendly (adequate button sizes). Ensure the “No” button moves within an overflow-hidden bounded container so it cannot cause horizontal scrolling; include touch handlers so evasion works without hover.

requirements.summary: Add the generated meme image under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it in the success state.
acceptanceCriteria: The image file exists at frontend/public/assets/generated/<filename> and is referenced directly by the frontend.
No backend endpoints are used to serve or transform the image at runtime.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static meme image asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/good-choice-meme.dim_900x600.png for direct use by the frontend (no backend involvement).
Reference and render the static image from frontend/public/assets/generated/good-choice-meme.dim_900x600.png in the “Yes” success state, ensuring it is loaded as a static asset (not via backend).
